SystemRequirements: Image Magick (for reading non PPM format), dcraw (for reading RAW images).
ADMIXTOOLS suite of command-line utilities for population genetics. See <https://reich.hms.harvard.edu/software> for the most recent installation instructions and further information.
None, but greater than 12 GB of RAM highly recommended.

ImageMagick (http://imagemagick.org) or GraphicsMagick (http://www.graphicsmagick.org) or LyX (http://www.lyx.org) for saveGIF(); (PDF)LaTeX for saveLatex(); SWF Tools (http://swftools.org) for saveSWF(); FFmpeg (http://ffmpeg.org) or avconv (https://libav.org/avconv.html) for saveVideo()
The exact (anti)clustering algorithms require that the GNU linear programming kit (GLPK library) is installed (<http://www.gnu.org/software/glpk/>). Rendering the vignette requires pandoc.
C++11; for AWS S3 support on Linux, libcurl and openssl (optional)
FFmpeg (>= 3.2); with at least libx264 and lame (mp3) drivers. Debian/Ubuntu: libavfilter-dev, Fedora/CentOS: ffmpeg-devel (via https://rpmfusion.org), MacOS Homebrew: ffmpeg.
GNU make, Cargo (>= 1.42.0) [the Rust package manager] for installation from sources: see file INSTALL
Rtools (>= 3.3) for Windows, Xcode (>= 9.0) for Mac OS X

Package 'bigsnpr' includes a few functions that wrap existing software such as 'PLINK' <www.cog-genomics.org/plink2>. Functions are provided to download these software. Note that these external software might not work for some operating systems (e.g. 'PLINK' might not work on Solaris).
C++11, cmake, fftw3, GNU make, soxr-lsr
A system with a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.8 or later).

Python and TensorFlow are needed for Bayesian inference computations; Python (>= 2.7.0) with header files and shared library; TensorFlow (= v1.14; https://www.tensorflow.org/); TensorFlow Probability (= v0.7.0; https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/)
xclip (https://github.com/astrand/xclip) or xsel (http://www.vergenet.net/~conrad/software/xsel/) for accessing the X11 clipboard

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb), libgmp3: apt-get install -y libgmp3-dev (deb), libfftw3: apt-get install -y libfftw3-dev (deb), libtiff5: apt-get install -y libtiff5-dev (deb)
pdfcrop (part of TexLive) is required to rebuild the vignettes.
couchDB instance to connect to and work with.
none, one or more of JAGS (>= 3.0.0), WinBUGS (>= 1.4), OpenBUGS (>= 3.2.2), Stan
GLPK library package (e.g., libglpk-dev on Debian/Ubuntu)
FreeType, Xft, or zlib (only needed for platforms other than OSX and Windows)
LibreOffice (<https://www.libreoffice.org/>) required to extract data from .doc files or perform .pptx conversion.
Requires the OpenMP library for parallel computing. If the OpenMP library is not available, the code is executed sequentially and a warning is printed.

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb)
GNU Scientific Library (GSL). Note: users should have GSL installed.
Python (>= 2.4), difflib, fuzzywuzzy ( >=0.15.0 ), python-Levenshtein ( >=0.12.0 ). Detailed installation instructions for each operating system can be found in the README file.
Debian or Ubuntu system with access to Goto Blas, Intel MKL, Atlas development build as well as a Nvidia GPU with CUDA support
The SequenomMarkers() marker design function requires 'vcftools' and 'Perl' on 'windows', and, in addition, 'awk' and 'bash' on '*nix'.
The package requires a C++11 compiler.
MongoDB (>= 3.4.0), Python (>= 2.7). Installation instructions and links can be found in the README file.
libgit2 (>= 0.26): libgit2-devel (rpm) or libgit2-dev (deb). A PPA is available for older Ubuntu LTS versions.

By default, git2r uses a system installation of the libgit2 headers and library. However, if a system installation is not available, builds and uses a bundled version of the libgit2 source. zlib headers and library. OpenSSL headers and library (non-macOS). LibSSH2 (optional on non-Windows) to enable the SSH transport.
GPGME: libgpgme-dev / libgpgme11-dev (deb), gpgme-devel (rpm) gpgme (brew). On Linux 'haveged' is recommended for generating entropy when using the GPG key generator.
Python (>= 2.7.0) with header files and shared library; TensorFlow (v1.14; https://www.tensorflow.org/); TensorFlow Probability (v0.7.0; https://www.tensorflow.org/probability/)
Python (>= 3.6) with header files and shared library; H2O4GPU (https://github.com/h2oai/h2o4gpu)
Apache Hadoop >= 2.7.2 (https://hadoop.apache.org/releases.html#Download); Obsolete: Hadoop core >= 0.19.1 and <= 1.0.3 or CDH3 (https://www.cloudera.com); standard unix tools (e.g., chmod)
LaTeX packages: adjustbox, array, calc, caption, colortbl, fontspec, graphicx, hhline, hyperref, multirow, siunitx, tabularx, threeparttable, ulem, wrapfig
Julia (>= 1.0) and Interpretable AI System Image (>= 1.0.0)
A C library with the fesetround/fegetround functions.
C++11 and OpenCV 3 or newer: libopencv-dev (Debian, Ubuntu) or opencv-devel (Fedora)
Impala driver to support a 'DBI'-compatible R interface
GNU make and Java JDK 1.2 or higher

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb)
Optional: libsecret on Linux (libsecret-1-dev on Debian/Ubuntu, libsecret-devel on Fedora/CentOS)
Package vignettes based on R Markdown v2 or reStructuredText require Pandoc (http://pandoc.org). The function rst2pdf() require rst2pdf (https://github.com/rst2pdf/rst2pdf).
At least trial version of LocalSolver to be downloaded from http://www.localsolver.com/download.html
A system with zoneinfo data (e.g. /usr/share/zoneinfo) as well as a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.8 or later). On Windows the zoneinfo included with R is used.
Python 3.x with following modules: PyGMO, NumPy, and cloudpickle
ADMB version 11 <http://admb-project.org/> for use.admb=TRUE; see readme.txt
On a Unix-alike, one of the C functions mach_absolute_time (macOS), clock_gettime or gethrtime. If none of these is found, the obsolescent POSIX function gettimeofday will be tried.
memory (>= 4GB) Ubuntu: build-essential, libxml2-dev, libssl-dev, libcurl4-openssl-dev Windows: Rtools (>= 3.5)
Apache Spark 2.0+, Apache Maven 3.5+, Java JDK 8, MLeap Runtime 0.10.1+
A C++11 compiler. Versions 4.8.*, 4.9.* or later of GCC will be fine.
gdal (optional), geos (optional), proj (optional), udunits (optional), gsl (optional), gmp (optional), glu (optional), jags (optional)

A valid account MUST be registered with Microsoft's Cognitive Services website <https://www.microsoft.com/cognitive-services/> in order to obtain a (free) API key. Without an API key, this package will not work properly.

A valid account MUST be registered with Microsoft's Cognitive Services website <https://www.microsoft.com/cognitive-services/> in order to obtain a (free) API key. Without an API key, this package will not work properly.
pandoc, jupyter, jupyter nbconvert ("nbconvert" python package), pywin32 (on windows)
A compiler with C++11 support for the thread library, Requires Rtools >= 33 (i.e. R >= 3.3.0) to build on Windows.
A system installation of NLopt >= 2.4.0 (with headers) will be used if available.
NetLogo (>= 5.3.1), Java (JDK 1.8), pandoc, OpenSSL, udunits-2, PROJ.4, GEOS, GDAL, libxml2
Python (>= 2.7), nmslib ( >= 1.7.1), scipy ( >= 1.0.0), numpy ( >= 1.14.0). Detailed installation instructions for each operating system can be found in the README file.
JAGS (http://mcmc-jags.sourceforge.net/) for analysis of Bayesian hierarchical models
C++11, GNU make, An ODBC3 driver manager and drivers.
OpenCV 3 or newer: libopencv-dev (Debian, Ubuntu) or opencv-devel (Fedora)

libarmadillo: apt-get install -y libarmadillo-dev (deb), libblas: apt-get install -y libblas-dev (deb), liblapack: apt-get install -y liblapack-dev (deb), libarpack++2: apt-get install -y libarpack++2-dev (deb), gfortran: apt-get install -y gfortran (deb), libjpeg-dev: apt-get install -y libjpeg-dev (deb), libpng-dev: apt-get install -y libpng-dev (deb), libfftw3-dev: apt-get install -y libfftw3-dev (deb), libtiff5-dev: apt-get install -y libtiff5-dev (deb)
To use the Localhost of OSRM, you need to build OSRM <https://github.com/Project-OSRM/osrm-backend/wiki/Building-OSRM> locally
pandoc (http://johnmacfarlane.net/pandoc) for exporting markdown files to other formats.
For the MERLIN wrapper, MERLIN (http://csg.sph.umich.edu/abecasis/Merlin/) must be installed and pointed to in the PATH environment variable.
The 'Japanese.Rnw' vignette requires uplatex and dvipdfmx.
OpenMPI (>= 1.5.4) on Solaris, Linux, Mac, and FreeBSD. MS-MPI (Microsoft HPC Pack 2012) or MPICH2 (>= 1.4.1p1) on Windows.
OpenMPI (>= 1.5.4) on Solaris, Linux, Mac, and FreeBSD. MS-MPI (Microsoft MPI v7.1 (SDK) and Microsoft HPC Pack 2012 R2 MS-MPI Redistributable Package) on Windows.
OpenMPI (>= 1.5.4) on Solaris, Linux, Mac, and FreeBSD. No MPI library required on Windows yet.
ssh (OpenSSH) or plink (PuTTY) on Solaris, Linux, and Mac.
'OpenMPI' (>= 1.5.4) on Solaris, Linux, Mac, and FreeBSD. 'MS-MPI' (Microsoft HPC Pack 2012 R2 MS-MPI Redistributable Package) on Windows.
Linux, Mac OSX, and Windows, or 'ZeroMQ' library >= 4.0.4. Solaris 10 needs 'ZeroMQ' library 4.0.7 and 'OpenCSW'.
Poppler C++ API: libpoppler-cpp-dev (deb) or poppler-cpp-devel (rpm). The unit tests also require the 'poppler-data' package (rpm/deb)
Phoenix NLME with Phoenix Modeling Language (PML) license
OpenSSL library and headers (openssl-dev or similar)
A POSIX system. Currently Linux and OS X are known to work. GNU make.
pandoc (http://pandoc.org) for building Vignettes and output reports as HTML
'python3' needs to built for the same architecture R is built for (32 or 64 bit).
Python (>= 2.7.0) with header files and shared library (UNIX) / static library (Windows)
OpenBugs for functions bugs() and openbugs() or WinBUGS 1.4 for function bugs()
pandoc (http://johnmacfarlane.net/pandoc) for exporting markdown files to other formats.

python >= 2.6, by default rasciidoc uses a system installation of asciidoc. If a system installation of asciidoc is not available, it downloads the sources from (<http://gitlab.com/asciidoc>). GNU source-highlight is recommended.
Java JRE 1.6 or higher ; Xuggle-xuggler-5.4.jar in library paths and class paths.

A valid Bloomberg installation. The API headers and dynamic library are downloaded from <https://github.com/Rblp/blp> during the build step. See <https://bloomberg.github.io/blpapi-docs/cpp/3.8> as well as <https://www.bloomberg.com/professional/support/api-library/> for API documentation. A compiler recent enough for (at least partial) C++11 support is required; g++-4.6.* or later should be sufficient and g++-4.9.* or later is preferred.
MOSEK (http://www.mosek.com) and MOSEK License for use of Rmosek,
IBM ILOG CPLEX libraries and headers

A 64-bit POSIX OS such as Linux or OS X with IANA time zone data in /usr/share/zoneinfo as well as a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.9 or later which is preferred, g++-4.8 works too). On Windows the zoneinfo included with R is used; and time parsing support is enabled via a backport of std::get_time from the LLVM libc++ library.

GNU make, ncurses, pcre (>= 7 < 10), GLib (>= 2.0.0). On Windows, no prior installations are necessary, as pre-built (i.e. cross-compiled) binaries of required libraries are downloaded from a GitHub repository (<https://github.com/PolMine/libcl>) during installation. On macOS, static libraries of Glib are downloaded (<https://github.com/PolMine/libglib>) if Glib is not present.
A POSIX system. Currently Linux and OS X are known to work.
MeCab 0.996 (or mecab-ko 0.9.2) or higher, GNU make
A C++11 compiler. Versions 4.8.*, 4.9.* or later of GCC will be fine.
GNU make, Windows: cmd.exe and cscript.exe, Solaris: g++ is required

An available hiredis library (eg via package libhiredis-dev on Debian/Ubuntu, hiredis-devel on Fedora/RedHat, or directly from source from <https://github.com/redis/hiredis>) is preferred but otherwise built on demand.
A C++11 compiler; g++ (>= 4.9.*) or newer works.
Python (>= 3.0), retriever (>= 3.0.0) (version must be listed to patch to allow parsing)
xclip (https://github.com/astrand/xclip) or xsel (http://www.vergenet.net/~conrad/software/xsel/) for accessing the X11 clipboard
GNU GSL for the GSL random-number generators
mono 4.x or higher on OSX / Linux, .NET 4.x or higher on Windows, 'msbuild' and 'nuget' available in the path
Mac OSX: redland (>= 1.0.14) ; Linux: librdf0 (>= 1.0.14), librdf0-dev (>= 1.0.14)
(Python and gym only required if gym environments are used)
Subversion for install_svn, git for install_git

PROJ (>= 4.8.0, https://proj.org/download.html) and GDAL (>= 1.11.4, https://gdal.org/download.html), with versions either (A) PROJ < 6 and GDAL < 3 or (B) PROJ >= 6 and GDAL >= 3. For degraded PROJ >= 6 and GDAL < 3, use the configure argument '--with-proj_api="proj_api.h"'.
GNU Scientific Library (>= 2.1), HDF5 (>= 1.8.13), libgeotiff (>= 1.4.0), szip (>= 2.1) zlib (>= 1.2)
GEOS (>= 3.2.0); for building from source: GEOS from http://trac.osgeo.org/geos/; GEOS OSX frameworks built by William Kyngesburye at http://www.kyngchaos.com/ may be used for source installs on OSX.
Python (2.7 or >= 3.4), rgf_python, scikit-learn (>= 0.18.0), scipy, numpy. Detailed installation instructions for each operating system can be found in the README file.

OpenGL, GLU Library, XQuartz (on OSX), zlib (optional on Unix, required on Windows), libpng (>=1.2.9, optional on Unix, required on Windows), FreeType (optional on Unix, required on Windows), pandoc (>=1.14, needed for vignettes)
GLPK library package (e.g., libglpk-dev on Debian/Ubuntu)
R built as a shared or static library, 'MPI' library.
Java JDK 1.2 or higher (for JRI/REngine JDK 1.4 or higher), GNU make
C++11, cmake (>= 3.10), clang (optional), CUDA (optional but recommended)
libmariadb-client-lgpl-dev or libmariadbclient-dev or libmysqlclient-dev, with libssl-dev (deb), mariadb-connector-c-devel or mariadb-devel (rpm), mariadb-connector-c or mysql-connector-c (brew)
notepad.exe, mark.exe (>= 8.0) (or mark32.exe and mark64.exe) and rel_32.exe (see README.txt)
libmariadb-client-dev | libmariadb-client-lgpl-dev | libmysqlclient-dev (deb), mariadb-devel (rpm), mariadb | mysql-connector-c (brew), mysql56_dev (csw)
An ODBC3 driver manager and drivers.

The tools to run 'R CMD SHLIB' on 'Fortran' code. The used 'Fortran' compiler must support pointer initialization which is a feature of the 2008 standard. The compiler from Oracle Developer Studio 12.6 on Solaris 10 currently does not meet this requirement.
GNU Make, GCC Compiler Suite (C and Fortran)
Oracle Instant Client or Oracle Database Client
Poppler Glib interface headers and libraries (<http://poppler.freedesktop.org/>) [Debian/Ubuntu: libpoppler-glib-dev, Fedora: poppler-glib-devel]
C++11, GNU make, Windows: cmd.exe and cscript.exe

ProtoBuf libraries and compiler version 2.2.0 or later; version 3.0.0 or later is supported as well. On Debian/Ubuntu these can be installed as libprotoc-dev, libprotobuf-dev and protobuf-compiler, while on Fedora/CentOS protobuf-devel and protobuf-compiler are needed.

A user API key (which one can request from the website at <http://www.pushbullet.com>), and one or more devices to push messages to which may be any one of an (Android or iOS) phone, a (Chrome or Firefox, or Opera or Safari) browser or the (Windows or Mac) desktop application provided the corresponding Pushbullet 'app' has been installed on any one of these.
QuantLib library (>= 1.14) from http://quantlib.org, Boost library from http://www.boost.org

The package depends on libraries from the RRD project <http://oss.oetiker.ch/rrdtool/>. On Debian-based systems, install 'librrd-dev', on CentOS based systems install 'rrdtool-devel', and on Fedora-based systems install 'rrdtool-devel' <https://apps.fedoraproject.org/packages/rrdtool-devel>. For more information, see the README.
need the RDRAND instruction on Intel CPU. and C compiler must be able to compile a GNU-style in-line assembler.

"conda (python>=3.6 pytorch torchvision cpuonly numpy ( >= 1.14.0) matplotlib pandas -c pytorch); python-minimal, pandoc pandoc-citeproc, qpdf; Python (>=3.6), pytorch (>=1.4), torchvision, cpuonly, numpy ( >= 1.14.0); pandoc (>= 2.0), qpdf ( >= 7.0) on Solaris"
Python (>=2.6) in path and NumPy module installed, ghostscript (>=9.0)
Cargo (>= 1.40.0) for installation from sources: see file INSTALL
mallinfo, hence Linux, MacOS or Windows
Java (>= 8) and maxent.jar >= 3.4.1 to use Maxent
GDAL (>= 2.1.2), PROJ (>= 4.9.1), GEOS (>= 3.4.2), Cairo, Curl, NetCDF, jq, Protocol Buffers, V8, OpenSSL, Libxml2.
C++11, zlib headers and libraries, GNU make, optionally also bzip2 and POSIX-compliant regex functions.
(PDF)LaTeX (https://www.latex-project.org/) with 'pdfpages' package for studentGrowthPlot option in visualizeSGP to bind together student growth plots into school catalogs
For playing sounds, a command line system tool for playing wav-files is required.
Python (>=3.5.2) and the following python module: nmrglue.
LilyPond (Only needed for rendering sheet music or writing MIDI files)
A system with a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.8 or later).
Tesseract >= 3.03 (libtesseract-dev / tesseract-devel) and Leptonica (libleptonica-dev / leptonica-devel). On Debian you need to install the English training data separately (tesseract-ocr-eng)
C++11, A modern compiler (>=gcc-4.9), And latexmk is necessary to compile all output documents with the functions provided by this package
pandoc (>= 1.12.3) suggested for using wordreg function; LaTeX packages tikz, booktabs, dcolumn, rotating, thumbpdf, longtable, paralist for the vignette
The package requires a C++11 compiler

cmake (only when TileDB source build selected), git (only when TileDB source build selected); on x86_64 platforms pre-built TileDB Embedded libraries are available at GitHub and are used if no TileDB installation is detected, and no other option to build or download was specified by by the user.
Python (>= 2.7), python-gdal library (For Windows, gdal installed via OSGeo4W <https://trac.osgeo.org/osgeo4w/> recommended) clipboard
A system with zoneinfo data (e.g. /usr/share/zoneinfo) as well as a recent-enough C++11 compiler (such as g++-4.8 or later). On Windows the zoneinfo included with R is used.

V8 engine version 6+ is needed for modern JS and WASM support. On Debian / Ubuntu install either libv8-dev or libnode-dev, on Fedora use v8-devel. The readme has instructions for installing backports on Ubuntu Xenial and Bionic. It is still possible to build this package against the legacy libv8 version 3.14 branch, but these engines only support traditional JavaScript (ES5).
virtuoso-opensource (Linux). For Mac & Windows, this package can automate Virtuoso installation.

PhantomJS (http://phantomjs.org) for taking screenshots, ImageMagick (http://www.imagemagick.org) or GraphicsMagick (http://www.graphicsmagick.org) and OptiPNG (http://optipng.sourceforge.net) for manipulating images.
Java (>= 5.0); WordNet database files (direct download: <https://wordnetcode.princeton.edu/3.0/WNdb-3.0.tar.gz>; Debian and Fedora package: wordnet)
The standalone program xgobi must be installed additionally, see file README, or INSTALL.windows under Windows
An ODBC3 driver manager and drivers.
